intro: Echidnopsis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy echidnopsis, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and compact growth habit. It produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring or summer. Echidnopsis hirsuta is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
